name: Royal Orchid Sheraton Hotel & Towers

reviews.title: Fantastic river view
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights beginning of April. Staff very polite and nothing was too much trouble.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The courtesy bus is a river rice barge which we took at every opportunity.
reviews.title: improved from previous visit

likes.disliked: — corridors not air conditioned - but only minor point

reviews.text: The view is fantastic - during the day we watched all sorts of river traffic, at night the lights were magical.
reviews.title: Nice view but room deco was old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was huge and set us up for the day, there was plenty of it whether you turned up at 6 am or 10 am.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was huge and for once the maid actually followed the instructions to not change our sheets and towells after they had only been used once!
reviews.title: Well Located Large Hotel

likes.liked: — The location; their treatment of Starwood elite members
likes.disliked: — The large size of the hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is very good location. On the river. Next to River City antique mall. Boat dock on property and tour boats next door. Hotel is a bit tired though being upgraded. Service was very good. No complaints. Good value.
reviews.title: Good location/Average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in 2007 and had nothing but a great experience. We booked the hotel from the starwood website and opted for the Towers rooms. These come on higher floors, free laundry (I think limited to 3 pieces per person per day), an excellent breakfast buffet and access to the towers lounge (free snacks and drinks in the evening with fabulous views of the Chao Prahya).
reviews.title: One of our favorites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a lovely view of the river and we spent almost 2 hours every morning just watching it come alive. We also could see Wat Arun in the distant horizon.
reviews.title: well located and peacefully calm

reviews.text: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge initially gave us names of restaurants that cater to tourists but when we told him we can stomach local food, he told us where to eat locally. We ended up eating street food and loved it. Did not get sick.
reviews.title: What a scam !
Great Service
reviews.text: They have two pools and both were good. We did not eat at the restaurants because we ended up eating a lot of street food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been around for a long time and is ideally situated on the banks of the Chao Phraya river with a shopping centre next door and superb views all around from its upper floor rooms. Staff are welcoming,efficient and courteous. Facilities are excellent and prices are reasonable for this five star standard hotel. It has numerous restaurants - all good but don't miss the nightly culture show whilst enjoying the buffet.
reviews.title: My Favorite in Bangkok.

reviews.text: Bangkok has many fine hotels and you may find better but this grand old dame suits us fine as it has matured over the years and gives the traveller everthing you want.
reviews.title: A really Beautiful place

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the entry and the location of the restaurants on the river

reviews.title: Great location for average hotel
reviews.text: About 45 minutes from the new airport depending on traffic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been coming to this hotel for the last ten years and every year it just seems to get better. The location on the river is ideal in that you can use th river taxis to get almost anywhere in the city, but yet it is close enough to the sky train to use that if you wish.
reviews.title: Nice place to hang you hat
Awesome views, slow service
reviews.text: The staff are super attentive and could not be more helpful. the rooms are not very spacious but have every amenity and the views from the window of the river and all its traffic is spellbinding.

The location is great with good views of the river. I really wouldn't advise visitors not to stay along the river as it is part of the charm of being in Bangkok. The lobby is pleasant and the reception was warm and friendly.
reviews.title: Good location but not the best along the river
followed the soccer
reviews.text: The rooms were relatively simple and the bathroom certainly looked a bit old although the water pressure in the shower was very good. The bed was nice and firm and gave a good night's sleep. All in all the rooms were not spectacular but I had just spent a couple of nights in the nearby Shangri-La in their new wing which was certainly of a higher standard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two outdoor pools, one of which is in a nice garden setting which is quite unusual in such a busy city location. This provided a welcome cool-down after a sticky day in Bangkok. The Sheraton shuttle boat is lovely with leather seats and the short trip to the nearby sky train station is every 30 minutes and free of charge.
reviews.title: Over-rated

reviews.text: The hotel was very full when we were there and they had problems accomodating all the guests for breakfast. On our first morning 4 of us were put on a table for 2 outside under the edge of a canopy whilst it was pouring with rain. Generally the breakfast experience was mediocre and we didn't use the restaurant for any other meals.
reviews.title: Luxury By the Riverside

reviews.text: All in all acceptable for a city location with a busy schedule in and around town but if you are looking for a little more luxury and relaxation, check out Shangri-La, Peninsula, Oriental etc.
reviews.title: Great Service, but . . . . . .

reviews.text: This is a massive 700 plus room hotel that has made the most of its riverfront location. Upon arrival, one knows it's going to be busy. There are two entrances, one congested with buses and reserved for tour groups and conventioneers, and the other somewhat charming with no-nonsense looking bell-men waiting to greet and assist arriving individual travelers. The lobby is cool and refreshing, with a wonderful fragrance (I think every Sheraton in the world has this same fragrance now), but it is full of people and a bit dim. Check in was a bit of a hassle since there were lots of people checking in and asking questions of the staff at the same time, and the boy who was helping us seemed new to the job, though he was very sweet and did his best.
reviews.title: The decor may be old and fading, but the views are as fresh as ever

reviews.text: On the check in counter, there are basins full of green apples, fresh, cold, and wonderfully sour; don't miss them!
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location for tourism

likes.disliked: — Taxis in Bangkok are bad -- but not the hotels problem.

reviews.text: Hotel Facilities: Older and well worn, but with occasional fresh surprises, like the green apples at check in. We stayed on the 12th floor. Coming out of the elevator, our noses were assaulted with extra strong cigarette fumes. It smelled like an airport smoking room! The room itself was smoke free though, and the view knocked all the bad memories away. The hotel has two pools, one that's in a garden by the river and is really appealing, the other is next to the health club and is somewhat small, but features nice views of the river. The garden pool closes very early, around 7pm I think, but the gym side pool appears to be open at least until 10pm. I recommend a night time swim, because that's when it's relatively quiet and there's just about no one around.
reviews.title: top hotel

likes.disliked: — food/drink prices but it is top hotel so cant grumble too much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who like spa experiences, this hotel is supposed to have an incredible spa (Mandara). All services are 30% off before 4pm.
reviews.title: hudson review london

reviews.text: Rooms: The rooms apparently underwent a light refurbishment a couple years ago. They are smallish, comfortable, but nothing special whatsoever, except the view. My biggest complaint is the toilet. When flushed, it makes a rocket like noise, and whoever is sleeping or relaxing in the room, gets jolted awake by the ruckus. Additionally, whoever dares sit on the toilet when it's flushed is in for a rear end shower.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Not right in hustle bustle of city
likes.disliked: — Pools wern't as nice as the pictures - though still very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on my travels to Bangkok, I am absolutely convinced that you want to stay on the Chao Phraya river, particularly if you are in Bangkok for tourist reasons and want to spend most of your time doing the typical tourism activities (such as the Grand Palace, Wat Po). This basically limits you to five options: the Sheraton, the Oriental, the Shangra-La, the Pennisula, and the Hilton.
reviews.title: Good Western Business Hotel with Perfect Location

likes.disliked: — its not the Oriental -- but very little is

reviews.text: If money were no object, this is not the best of the five. For example, the Sheraton is clearly inferior to the Oriental (but virtually all hotels are inferior to the Oriental). But I had no complaints with the Sheraton -- this is a high-quality, western luxury facilities with excellent facilities and a very helpful staff. The views, in particular, are fantastic. And for starwood members, the hotel requires remarkably few points to get a free room -- it is a real bargain. The hotel also has very good internet access.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One other tip -- as an alternative to the hotel buffet breakfast, there is a French patissiere on the northern side of the hotel -- next to the cross-ferry ferry station. The patissiere is surprisingly good, I've had worse croissants in Paris.
reviews.title: TOP EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience with this hotel in every way. Stayed 2 nights in the towers with a starwood upgrade. I highly recommend this if you can afford it. It was entirely worth it.
reviews.title: Fantastic oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After our taxi driver started driving in circles, we walked the remainder of the way to the hotel. Walked up to the starwood desk, gave my name and without delay was escorted to the 26th floor lounge for cold towels and drinks while they processed my registration. Excellent service from the front desk and concierge, best continental breakfast I have ever had, very good room and good location. The pool was beautiful and a welcome respite from the heat although the food there was predictably overpriced. This was truly an oasis in BKK for my wife and I.
reviews.title: Riverside, hassle free hotel

reviews.text: Such a shame that the hotel has changed the goal posts with the rules for the club lounge, we have stayed twice before and have always booked Club rooms with all the benefits. Now they tell me that our daughter (13) cannot go into the club lounge during happy hour. This is so disappointing as she has done this since she was much younger and the views etc from this lounge are fantastic, having a pre dinner drink here with nibbles is very pleasant but now under 18 you cannot frequent this lounge. To be honest the hotel is otherwise average so would now find somewhere else to stay. Lucky I read the small print.
reviews.title: Club Rooms

reviews.text: We stayed here during the Loy Krathong festival. The hotel put on a great show next to the river with fireworks, a beauty contest, singers and traditional dancing. All four of us enjoyed the evening. We staying a suite in the low rise tower. The suite was clean and functional but a little dated. The foyer, restaurants, bar, pools etc were excellent. I have stayed at the following hotels in Bangkok and rate them in order.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Rooms a little dated.

reviews.text: 1. Peninsula

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Westin Banyan Tree
reviews.title: Tower room worth the extra spend

likes.liked: — The fabulous views and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Royal Orchid Sheraton
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Bangkok

likes.liked: — Excellent breakfasts included w/room. Clean; perfect service;
likes.disliked: — They had the audacity to change my name under the reservation with my husband's name. Sexist!

reviews.title: Great Location and facilities, but...
reviews.text: As a travel agent visiting Bangkok, I chose the Sheraton Orchid as one of the two properties to examine during my week-long stay.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: Location: The Sheraton Orchid is on the east side of the river which divides Bangkok (north-south). It is a short distance north of the Taksin Bridge Pier where you can take the hotel shuttle boat or the water taxi service to the hotel. The Taksin Pier area is also where you take the Skytrain.
Facilities: The hotel is a typical Sheraton hotel, with a few upgrades -- several restaurants, two pools, Mandara Spa, Business center, etc.
reviews.title: Full of charm....pity about the beauty salon

likes.liked: — The river views, pools and food
likes.disliked: — the beauty salon at the hotel

reviews.title: Good location...Not the best riverside hotel..Still worth a try
reviews.text: Room: The room I occupied was a riverfront room with a spectacular panorama southwest across the river and overlooking the pools. The double-bedded room had very comfortable beds. The bathroom, however, could use some cleaning up - especially the dingy tile around the bathtub/shower.

reviews.title: Great hotel, one or two staff let it down
reviews.text: Room service: I ordered room service twice in the three days there and both times was very pleased -- the Thai Dinner Set was very nice. Service was prompt, courteous, and the food was warm and delicious.

Family stay in two rooms overlooking the river which is a must. Rooms clean and good and staff helpful and attentive. Superb buffett breakfast, free internet and a superb lower pool and swim up bar. Free ferry to the MDS station which was uselful for the shopping trips and easy to use. MDS Dock not the best place but right next to the station and although grubby its not threatening. All sight seeing trips are not expensive in our terms and a guide makes a world of difference and the hotel organised some trips for us that were not more expensive than street touts.
reviews.title: good location and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ayaunthanya the old capital day trip coach up boat back was very interesting and good value. For fussy family eating visit the top floor food hall at the main shop at the stadium station exit. A wide range of different foods are freshly cooked from asian to pizza from little restuarants on a sort of buffett style and the shop is stuffed full of little market stores at the same or cheaper prices than the nearby street market on the main road.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Sheraton and wished we had been able to stay longer. I have read some of the regative reviews on this site about the hotel and cannot understand them at all, it is like they are written about a different hotel!
reviews.title: Good Hotel & Good Value

likes.liked: — Great value. Nice rooms for a good price.
likes.disliked: — A little far from other interesting spots

reviews.text: We had a lovely spacious, clean and modern room on one of the higher floors with a wonderful view over the river. There was fresh exotic fruit and chocolate on arrival which was a nice surprise. I am very sensative to cigarette smoke and can honestly say I never smelled any smoke or a stale smell (as mentioned by some of the other reviewers) during the whole visit.
reviews.title: Great 5 star, great for trip base

reviews.text: The breakfast was outstanding, it took us all of three visits to discover everything, we were particularly impressed with the huge chocolate fountain! The garden pool area was lovely, especially the swim-up cocktail bar.
reviews.title: Go at your own risk

reviews.text: Having read some of the recent reviews of the Royal Orchid Sheraton I confirmed my booking with a fair degree of trepidation. However, given that the conference I was attending was located in the hotel I decided that I’d go ahead rather than travel from one of the other hotels’ in Bangkok where I usually stay like the Hyatt.
reviews.title: All you need is a smile ...

likes.liked: — View of the Chao Phraya River

reviews.text: Before I go onto describe the hotel, I have to admit to being a complete wimp as I booked a car transfer from the airport through the hotel. Why? Well I once spent two and a half hours being driven around Bangkok in a taxi not knowing that we had gone past the hotel (via various nefarious means) at least five times!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: On another slight diversion, I have to say that I do find getting through customs and immigration in Thailand always leaves me with a slightly odd sensation. I think it comes from the omnipresent Thai smile that emanates from everyone, even the boarder guards!
reviews.title: Best beds in Thailand

reviews.text: Anyhow, as I exited into the main arrival hall I was met by a representative from the hotel (also smiling) and taken to wait for the car which arrived exactly three minutes later. I was given a very welcome bottle of cold water and a cool wet towel and settled back for the drive to the hotel … accompanied by … you guessed it … a smiling driver.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is tucked away down a couple of rather dingy streets and so the first impressions are not exactly terrific. I was greeted very warmly and headed to the front desk to check in. I arrived around 5:30PM to be told that my room would not be available for “around 45 minutes”. The front desk was so apologetic and offered me free drinks in the lobby lounge. I declined and settled down with my book. 15 minutes later one of the front staff appeared to check I was OK. Another ten minutes went by and the front desk manager appeared to apologize and offer me more drinks! By the time I got my keys (an hour and ten minutes after I arrived) and headed to my room I was actually feeling like I should be apologizing for having put them to so much trouble! I headed up to the 7th floor only to find the key wouldn’t work so back down to the lobby. More apologies, lots of bowing by both sides and I headed back up to my room.
reviews.title: Good Value for money

likes.disliked: — no free internet access for guests with own laptop (1 hour free which is useless)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Bangkok for 4 nights and was really glad we chose to stay near the river it just seems that bit calmer and not as humid. It is so easy to get into the centre with the hotel river taxi which is very smart then on the skytrain and to get to the Grand Palace which would def recommend you can get another river taxi near the hotel and def do not believe anyone that say's it is shut or try's to direct you as they tried to send us the wrong way, the entrance is straight on up the road from getting off the ferry. The hotel was lovely it was nice and relaxing around the pools and the room was spacious & nice with a view of the river there was work being carried out but it just woke us up for breakfast & stopped about 18:00 so did not bother us as we was out most of the day but if you was going there to chill in the room in the daytime it can be noisy with the drills. I would def recommend the hotel for the location and the staff where lovely the only downside was the price of food/drinks it was ridiculous to say you can go outside to the stalls, 7 Eleven or River City next door and buy everything for a snip of the price, you do get some free water in the bathroom though.
reviews.title: Lovely by the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I selected a number of hotels using Trip Advisor and then discussed them with our travel agent. The Sheraton Royal Orchid Hotel and Towers offered us the best value for money at that time so we booked 6 nights from 25th October 2008.
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel

reviews.text: After a long hectic flight from Perth via Phuket and a bus trip from the airport we finally arrived at the Sheraton. At first I was a bit concerned because the entrance to the Hotel is via a number of back streets but on arriving we were both suitably impressed.
reviews.title: Great Club Lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were escorted to Check In by very friendly staff and was told that because we had booked for more than 4 nights we were going to be upgraded to a Junior Suite (no argument from us).
reviews.title: Better Value Elsewhere on the River

likes.disliked: — small rooms in need of an update, average restaurants

reviews.text: Check in took about 10 minutes and then we were escorted to our room (2414) and what a room it was. Consisting of three rooms (Lounge, Bedroom and Bathroom) it had sweeping views of the Chao Praya River and Bangkok. The Chao Praya is a working river and there were always boats and barges going back and forth 24/7.
reviews.title: lots of amenities

reviews.text: There are five luxury hotels in that area, and this one is considered the lowest priced from the quintet. Hotel is in line with expectations. No positive or negative surprises to speak of. When I booked, a tower "luxury" room was an extra $10, and that is probably a no brainer choice. Just bring your on-line reservation printout along, so the dude at the desk does not get confused with what is being checked in.
reviews.title: In LIne With Expectations

reviews.text: Like I said, no surprises here. Usual lobby marble, helpful concierge, (bit above average actually), few nice restaurants, luxury room gets one a high floor room, cool view of the river, gym, pool, free DSL computer on the mezzanine . . . . the usual run for a Sheraton room.
reviews.title: Pleasant retreat in a hectic city

likes.liked: — Modern, first-class facility with great service and amenities
likes.disliked: — Room a little small to entertain fellow travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed four nights using my Starwood points. We bought the Towers Upgrade on a promo for an additional 2000 Baht per night. That gave us a newly renovated room on the 25th floor with a great view of the river. Also included 6-pieces of laundry, buffet breakfast, evening cocktails and appetizers. Reception clerk escorted us to the 27th floor check-in, and our bags magically appeared in the room.
reviews.title: great

reviews.text: Courteous, prompt service received at all times.
reviews.title: room with a perfect view of chaopraya river

reviews.text: Good buffet breakfast with everything you could want, great evening cocktails, same-day laundry service, even a wide selection at okay prices on the room service menu.
reviews.title: Exceptional Views - Great Location

aka: Royal Orchid Sheraton Hotel And Towers
description: Located on the legendary Chao Phraya River with exquisite views, we offer a pleasant combination of warm Thai hospitality and world-class service in a modern setting just minutes from Bangkok's business districts, entertainment, and attractions.Enjoy the refined style and modern comforts of a relaxing riverside hotel. Take time out at our two pools or book a spa treatment, discover exciting cuisine in our six restaurants and bars, or experience memorable events in 22 unrivaled function rooms.All 726 of our spacious guest rooms and suites boast spectacular panoramic river views. Revel in the warm, calming, and contemporary ambiance of these well-appointed accommodations, featuring subtle Thai style and the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper™ Bed.
